Quantization helps reduce the memory requirement of a deep neural network by quantizing weights, biases and activations of network layers to 8-bit scaled integer data types. Use MATLAB® to retrieve the prediction results.

The FOC algorithm requires rotor position feedback, which is obtained by a quadrature encoder sensor. For details about FOC, see Field-Oriented Control (FOC) (Motor Control Blockset).

This personal radio service uses channelized frequencies in the ultra high frequency (UHF) band. Devices operating in the FRS band must be authorized under Part 95 Subpart B "Family Radio Service" (Sections 95.191 through 95.194) of the FCC rules. The authorized bandwidth of FRS channels is 12.5 KHz and the center frequency separation between channels is 25 KHz.

ref.name: End-to-End QAM Simulation with RF Impairments and Corrections
ref.alt: End-to-End QAM Simulation with RF Impairments and Corrections
ref.sum: Visualization capabilities that show the effects of RF impairments and corrections in a satellite downlink.

ref.name: 5G LDPC Block Error Rate Simulation Using the Cloud or a Cluster
ref.alt: 5G LDPC Block Error Rate Simulation Using the Cloud or a Cluster
ref.sum: Use the cloud or a cluster for block error rate (BLER) simulation of low-density parity-check (LDPC) coding for the 5G NR downlink shared transport channel (DL-SCH).

ref.name: OFDM Wi-Fi Scanner Using SDR Preamble Detection
ref.alt: OFDM Wi-Fi Scanner Using SDR Preamble Detection
ref.sum: Retrieve Wi-Fi network information from captured OFDM packets.

ref.name: Recover and Analyze Packets in 802.11 Waveform
ref.alt: Recover and Analyze Packets in 802.11 Waveform
ref.sum: Blindly detect, decode, and analyze IEEE 802.11 packets in a waveform.

ref.name: Bluetooth BR/EDR Waveform Generation and Transmission Using SDR
ref.alt: Bluetooth BR/EDR Waveform Generation and Transmission Using SDR
ref.sum: Generate and transmit Bluetooth BR/EDR waveform by using SDR.

ref.name: SAR Target Classification Using Deep Learning
ref.alt: SAR Target Classification Using Deep Learning
ref.sum: Create and train a simple convolution neural network to classify SAR targets using deep learning.

ref.name: Extended Target Tracking with Multipath Radar Reflections in Simulink
ref.alt: Extended Target Tracking with Multipath Radar Reflections in Simulink
ref.sum: Model and mitigate multipath radar reflections in a highway driving scenario in Simulink similarly to the Highway Vehicle Tracking with Multipath Radar Reflections MATLAB example.

ref.name: Maritime Clutter Suppression with Neural Networks
ref.alt: Maritime Clutter Suppression with Neural Networks
ref.sum: Train and evaluate a convolutional neural network to remove clutter returns from maritime radar PPI images using the Deep Learning Toolbox™.

ref.name: Display Animation of Radar Images over GOES Backdrop
ref.alt: Display Animation of Radar Images over GOES Backdrop
ref.sum: Display a movie of radar images collected once per hour over a backdrop.

ref.name: Air Traffic Control
ref.alt: Air Traffic Control
ref.sum: Generate an air traffic control scenario, simulate radar detections from an airport surveillance radar (ASR), and configure a global nearest neighbor (GNN) tracker to track the simulated targets using the radar detections. This enables you to evaluate different target scenarios, radar requirements, and tracker configurations without needing access to costly aircraft or equipment. This example covers the entire synthetic data workflow.

ref.name: Planning Radar Network Coverage over Terrain
ref.alt: Planning Radar Network Coverage over Terrain
ref.sum: Plan a radar network using propagation modeling over terrain and use the radar equation to determine whether target locations can be detected.

ref.name: Radar Link Budget Analysis
ref.alt: Radar Link Budget Analysis
ref.sum: Use the Radar Designer app to perform a link budget analysis when designing a radar system.

ref.name: Radar Architecture: System Components and Requirements Allocation (Part 1)
ref.alt: Radar Architecture: System Components and Requirements Allocation (Part 1)
ref.sum: Starting from a set of performance requirements, design, implement, and test a radar system in Simulink - Part 1.

ref.name: Define and Test Tracking Architectures for System-of-Systems
ref.alt: Define and Test Tracking Architectures for System-of-Systems
ref.sum: Define the tracking architecture of a system-of-systems that includes multiple detection-level multi-object trackers and track-level fusion algorithms. You can use the tracking architectures to compare different tracking system designs and find the best solution for your system.

ref.name: Radar Performance Analysis over Terrain
ref.alt: Radar Performance Analysis over Terrain
ref.sum: The performance of a radar system can depend on its operating environment. This example shows how radar detection performance improves as target elevation increases above the terrain.

ref.name: Simulate and Track Targets with Terrain Occlusions
ref.alt: Simulate and Track Targets with Terrain Occlusions
ref.sum: Model a surveillance scenario in a mountainous region where terrain can occlude both ground and aerial vehicles from the surveillance radar. You define a tracking scenario with geo-referenced terrain data from a Digital Terrain Elevation Data (DTED) file, create trajectories following terrain, simulate the scenario, and track targets with a multi-object tracker.

ref.name: Simulated Land Scenes for Synthetic Aperture Radar Image Formation
ref.alt: Simulated Land Scenes for Synthetic Aperture Radar Image Formation
ref.sum: Simulate I/Q signals from a synthetic aperture radar (SAR) system that uses platform motion to mimic a longer aperture to improve cross-range resolution using a range migration focusing algorithm.

ref.name: Adaptive Tracking of Maneuvering Targets with Managed Radar
ref.alt: Adaptive Tracking of Maneuvering Targets with Managed Radar
ref.sum: Employ radar resource management to efficiently track multiple maneuvering targets and use an interacting multiple model (IMM) filter to estimate when the target is maneuvering to optimize radar revisit times.

ref.name: Multibeam Radar for Adaptive Search and Track
ref.alt: Multibeam Radar for Adaptive Search and Track
ref.sum: Use radarDataGenerator as part of a closed-loop simulation of a multifunction phased array radar (MPAR) tracking multiple maneuvering targets.

ref.name: Track Space Debris Using a Keplerian Motion Model
ref.alt: Track Space Debris Using a Keplerian Motion Model
ref.sum: Model earth-centric trajectories using custom motion models within trackingScenario, how to configure a fusionRadarSensor in monostatic mode to generate synthetic detections of space debris, and how to setup a multi-object tracker to track the simulated targets.

ref.name: Modeling Mutual Coupling in Large Arrays Using Embedded Element Pattern
ref.alt: Modeling Mutual Coupling in Large Arrays Using Embedded Element Pattern
ref.sum: Model mutual coupling effects between array elements by using an embedded pattern technique. The example models an array two ways: (1) using the pattern of the isolated element or (2) using the embedded element pattern, and then compares both with the full-wave Method of Moments (MoM)-based solution of the array.

ref.name: Conventional and Adaptive Beamformers
ref.alt: Conventional and Adaptive Beamformers
ref.sum: Apply three beamforming algorithms to narrowband array data: the phase shift beamformer, the minimum variance distortionless response (MVDR) beamformer, and the linearly constrained minimum variance (LCMV) beamformer.

ref.name: Radar and Communications Waveform Classification Using Deep Learning
ref.alt: Radar and Communications Waveform Classification Using Deep Learning
ref.sum: Classify radar and communications waveforms using the Wigner-Ville distribution (WVD) and a deep convolutional neural network (CNN).

ref.name: Rectangular Array MVDR Beamformer
ref.alt: Rectangular Array MVDR Beamformer
ref.sum: Implement a minimum-variance distortionless-response (MVDR) beamformer for a 4x4 rectangular antenna array on FPGA.

ref.name: Processor-in-the-Loop Verification of JPDA Tracker for Automotive Applications
ref.alt: Processor-in-the-Loop Verification of JPDA Tracker for Automotive Applications
ref.sum: Generate embedded code for a JPDA tracker and verify it using processor-in-the-loop (PIL) simulations.

ref.name: Perform PK/PD Modeling and Simulation to Guide Dosing Strategy for Antibiotics
ref.alt: Perform PK/PD Modeling and Simulation to Guide Dosing Strategy for Antibiotics
ref.sum: Perform a Monte Carlo simulation of a pharmacokinetic/pharmacodynamic (PK/PD) model for an antibacterial agent. This example is adapted from Katsube et al. [1] This example also shows how to use the SimBiology® SimFunction object to perform parameter scans in parallel.

ref.name: Simulate the Glucose-Insulin Response
ref.alt: Simulate the Glucose-Insulin Response
ref.sum: Simulate and analyze a physiologically based glucose-insulin model for normal and diabetic patients.

ref.name: Exploring Protein-DNA Binding Sites from Paired-End ChIP-Seq Data
ref.alt: Exploring Protein-DNA Binding Sites from Paired-End ChIP-Seq Data
ref.sum: Perform a genome-wide analysis of a transcription factor in the Arabidopsis Thaliana (Thale Cress) model organism.

ref.name: Count RNA-Seq Reads Using Biopipeline Designer
ref.alt: Count RNA-Seq Reads Using Biopipeline Designer
ref.sum: Create a bioinformatics pipeline to count RNA-Seq reads that are mapped to genomic features.

ref.name: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes from RNA-Seq Data
ref.alt: Identifying Differentially Expressed Genes from RNA-Seq Data
ref.sum: Use a negative binomial model to test RNA-Seq data for differentially expressed genes.

ref.alt: Find Important Parameters for Receptor Occupancy with Global Sensitivity Analysis Using SimBiology Model Analyzer
ref.sum: Perform GSA analyses, such as Sobol indices, elementary effects, and multiparametric GSA, to find important model parameters in a target-mediated drug disposition model.

ref.name: Explore Biological Variability with Virtual Patients Using SimBiology Model Analyzer
ref.alt: Explore Biological Variability with Virtual Patients Using SimBiology Model Analyzer
ref.sum: Generate sample values for model parameters to represent virtual patients, simulate to explore tumor growth variability, and investigate the effects of dosing regimens on tumor size.

ref.name: Calculate NCA Parameters and Fit Model to PK/PD Data Using SimBiology Model Analyzer
ref.alt: Calculate NCA Parameters and Fit Model to PK/PD Data Using SimBiology Model Analyzer
ref.sum: Calibrate model parameters by performing noncompartmental analysis and fitting to experimental PKPD data using nonlinear regression.

ref.name: Model the Population Pharmacokinetics of Phenobarbital in Neonates
ref.alt: Model the Population Pharmacokinetics of Phenobarbital in Neonates
ref.sum: Perform nonlinear mixed-effects modeling using clinical pharmacokinetic data.

ref.name: Estimate the Bioavailability of a Drug
ref.alt: Estimate the Bioavailability of a Drug
ref.sum: Fit a model of absorption and excretion of the drug ondansetron to estimate its bioavailability.

ref.name: Model the United States Economy
ref.alt: Model the United States Economy
ref.sum: Use a vector error-correction model as a linear alternative to the Smets-Wouters DSGE macroeconomic model.

ref.name: Hedge Options Using Reinforcement Learning Toolbox
ref.alt: Hedge Options Using Reinforcement Learning Toolbox
ref.sum: Outperform the traditional BSM approach using an optimal option hedging policy.

ref.name: Use Deep Learning to Approximate Barrier Option Prices with Heston Model
ref.alt: Use Deep Learning to Approximate Barrier Option Prices with Heston Model
ref.sum: Use Deep Learning Toolbox™ to train a network and obtain predictions on barrier option prices with a Heston model.

ref.name: Backtest Strategies Using Deep Learning
ref.alt: Backtest Strategies Using Deep Learning
ref.sum: Construct trading strategies using a deep learning model and then backtest the strategies using the Financial Toolbox™ backtesting framework. The example uses Deep Learning Toolbox™ to train a predictive model from a set of time series and demonstrates the steps necessary to convert the model output into trading signals. It builds a variety of trading strategies that backtest the signal data over a 5-year period.

ref.name: Interpret and Stress-Test Deep Learning Networks for Probability of Default
ref.alt: Interpret and Stress-Test Deep Learning Networks for Probability of Default
ref.sum: Train a credit risk for probability of default (PD) prediction using a deep neural network. The example also shows how to use the locally interpretable model-agnostic explanations (LIME) and Shapley values interpretability techniques to understand the predictions of the model. In addition, the example analyzes model predictions for out-of-sample values and performs a stress-testing analysis.

ref.name: Incorporate Macroeconomic Scenario Projections in Loan Portfolio ECL Calculations
ref.alt: Incorporate Macroeconomic Scenario Projections in Loan Portfolio ECL Calculations
ref.sum: Generate macroeconomic scenarios and perform expected credit loss (ECL) calculations for a portfolio of loans. The workflow in this example shows important computational steps required to estimate provisions for credit losses following regulations such as IFRS 9 or CECL. In practice, the determination of loan provisions is a much more involved operational program requiring the collaboration of multiple departments in an institution. The goal of this example is to show useful computational tools that can support this process.

ref.name: Portfolio Optimization Examples Using Financial Toolbox
ref.alt: Portfolio Optimization Examples Using Financial Toolbox
ref.sum: Follow a sequence of examples that highlight features of the Portfolio object. Specifically, the examples use the Portfolio object to show how to set up mean-variance portfolio optimization problems that focus on the two-fund theorem, the impact of transaction costs and turnover constraints, how to obtain portfolios that maximize the Sharpe ratio, and how to set up two popular hedge-fund strategies — dollar-neutral and 130-30 portfolios.

ref.name: Backtest Investment Strategies Using Financial Toolbox
ref.alt: Backtest Investment Strategies Using Financial Toolbox
ref.sum: Perform backtesting of portfolio strategies using a backtesting framework. Backtesting is a useful tool to compare how investment strategies perform over historical or simulated market data. This example develops five different investment strategies and then compares their performance after running over a one-year period of historical stock data. The backtesting framework is implemented in two Financial Toolbox™ classes: backtestStrategy and backtestEngine.

ref.name: Diversify ESG Portfolios
ref.alt: Diversify ESG Portfolios
ref.sum: Include qualitative factors for environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG) in the portfolio selection process. The example extends the traditional mean-variance portfolio using a Portfolio object to include the ESG metric. First, the estimateFrontier function computes the mean-variance efficient frontier for different ESG levels. Then, the example illustrates how to combine the ESG performance measure with portfolio diversification techniques. Specifically, it introduces hybrid models that use the Herfindahl-Hirshman (HH) index and the most diversified portfolio (MDP) approach using the estimateCustomObjectivePortfolio function. Finally, the backtestEngine framework compares the returns and behavior of the different ESG strategies.

ref.name: Create Hierarchical Risk Parity Portfolio
ref.alt: Create Hierarchical Risk Parity Portfolio
ref.sum: Compute a hierarchical risk parity (HRP) portfolio. You can use HRP as a technique for portfolio diversification where the assets are divided and weighted according to a hierarchical tree structure. The weights of the assets within a cluster and between clusters can be assigned in many ways. A few ideas of the ways to allocate the weights are:

ref.name: Price American Basket Options Using Standard Monte Carlo and Quasi-Monte Carlo Simulation
ref.alt: Price American Basket Options Using Standard Monte Carlo and Quasi-Monte Carlo Simulation
ref.sum: Model the fat-tailed behavior of asset returns and assess the impact of alternative joint distributions on basket option prices. Using various implementations of a separable multivariate Geometric Brownian Motion (GBM) process, often referred to as a multi-dimensional market model, the example simulates risk-neutral sample paths of an equity index portfolio and prices basket put options using the technique of Longstaff & Schwartz.

ref.name: Calibrate Shifted SABR Model Parameters for Swaption Instrument

ref.sum: Export models to web views and navigate the views.

ref.sum: Compare the solution of a nonlinear problem both with and without integer constraints.

ref.sum: Analyze a bracket under an applied load and determine the maximal deflection by using the unified workflow.

ref.sum: Find the heat distribution in a block with a cavity by using the unified workflow.

ref.sum: Find the electrostatic potential in an air-filled annular quadrilateral frame by using the unified workflow.

ref.sum: Model an engine cooling system with an oil cooling circuit.

ref.alt: Deploy Simscape Buck Converter Model to Speedgoat IO Module Using HDL Workflow Script
ref.sum: Deploy buck converter modeled in Simscape to Speedgoat IO modules using HDL Workflow script.

ref.alt: Modeling and Control of a Mars Rover
ref.sum: Models a mars rover performing a sample retrieval task using Simscape Multibody and Robotics System Toolbox. The rover follows a desired path on a rigid terrain surface, stops at the target location and uses its manipulator to pick and store a sample from the surface. It uses the following key features to model different aspects of the application:

ref.name: Three-Phase Asynchronous Wind Turbine Generator

ref.alt: Power-Split Hybrid Transmission
ref.sum: The basic architecture of a power-split hybrid transmission. The planetary gear, along with the motor and generator, acts like a variable ratio gear. In this test, the vehicle accelerates, maintains the faster speed, and then decelerates back to the original speed. The power management strategy uses just stored electrical power to effect the maneuver, the combustion engine only delivering the power required to maintain the original speed.

ref.name: Electric Vehicle Configured for HIL

ref.name: Model Fault-Tolerant Fuel Control System
ref.alt: Model Fault-Tolerant Fuel Control System

This type of modeling is particularly useful for systems that have numerous possible operational modes based on discrete events. Traditional signal flow is handled in Simulink while changes in control configuration are implemented in Stateflow. The model described in this example represents a fuel control system for a gasoline engine. The system is robust in that it detects individual sensor failures, and the control system is dynamically reconfigured for uninterrupted operation.

ref.alt: Simulation of a Medical Device
ref.sum: Conduct automated tests to model a medical device that analyzes biology samples.

ref.sum: Model high-speed backplanes from S-parameters and analyze them using rational function.

ref.sum: The necessity of managing the adaptive loop update factors to ensure that the numerous adaptive loops don't fight against each other.

ref.sum: Analyze communication links and coverage areas in an urban environment.
